headline: A Mash-Up of Camp and Compassion
abstract: Charles Busch’s mash-up of mother-love weepies finds both pathos and hilarity in the tough talk of Hollywood divas.
lead_paragraph: For all their freedoms and frank carnality, the movies of Hollywood’s pre-Code era — roughly 1929 to 1934 — were often about sacrifice. A woman’s sacrifice, to be sure: her honor in exchange for a man’s, her happiness for her child’s.
